description.overview: A dynamic full-body exercise performed in plank position, alternately driving knees toward chest in a running motion. Builds cardiovascular endurance while strengthening core, shoulders, and hip flexors.
description.setup: Start in high plank position, hands shoulder-width apart directly under shoulders. Body forms straight line from head to heels, core engaged.
description.movement: Drive one knee toward chest while keeping other leg extended. Quickly switch legs in alternating pattern, maintaining plank position throughout.
description.cues: Hips level with shoulders, quick feet, breathe rhythmically, shoulders over hands

description.overview: A high-intensity full-body exercise combining a squat thrust, plank, and jump. One of the most effective exercises for conditioning, working every major muscle group while building explosive power.
description.setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms at sides. Prepare to move through multiple positions fluidly.
description.movement: Squat down, place hands on floor. Jump feet back to plank. Optional push-up. Jump feet to hands. Explosively jump up with arms overhead.
description.cues: Land softly, chest touches floor in push-up, full hip extension at top, maintain rhythm

description.overview: An explosive plyometric exercise combining a bodyweight squat with a vertical jump. Develops lower body power, improves athletic performance, and builds strength in quads, glutes, and calves.
description.setup: Feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out. Arms at sides or in front for balance. Core braced.
description.movement: Lower into squat position, hips back and down. From bottom position, explosively drive through feet to jump vertically. Land softly back into squat position.
description.cues: Explode through heels, reach for ceiling, land toe-ball-heel, absorb landing with bent knees

description.overview: A foundational isometric core exercise holding the body rigid in a straight line. Builds core stability, shoulder endurance, and teaches proper bracing for other exercises.
description.setup: Forearms on ground, elbows under shoulders. Feet together or hip-width apart. Body forms straight line from head to heels.
description.movement: Hold position while breathing normally. Maintain neutral spine throughout. Engage core, glutes, and quads to prevent sagging.
description.cues: Push floor away with forearms, tuck pelvis slightly, breathe into belly, squeeze everything

description.overview: An isometric lateral core exercise targeting obliques and lateral stabilizers. Essential for developing anti-lateral flexion strength and protecting the spine during loaded movements.
description.setup: Lie on side, elbow under shoulder. Stack or stagger feet. Bottom forearm perpendicular to body.
description.movement: Lift hips to create straight line from head to feet. Hold position while breathing normally. Keep hips stacked, don't rotate.
description.cues: Push floor away with elbow, lift hips to ceiling, long straight line, engage everything

description.overview: A unilateral balance exercise standing on one foot. Improves proprioception, strengthens stabilizing muscles, and enhances balance for injury prevention.
description.setup: Stand tall, weight on one foot. Lift other foot slightly off ground. Arms out for balance or at sides for challenge.
description.movement: Hold position on single leg. Keep standing knee slightly bent. Maintain upright posture. Switch legs after time.
description.cues: Grip floor with toes, soft knee, tall spine, focus on fixed point

description.overview: A fundamental bodyweight pushing exercise performed prone. Builds upper body strength and endurance while developing core stability and teaching proper pressing mechanics.
description.setup: High plank position, hands slightly wider than shoulders. Fingers spread, pointing forward. Body straight from head to heels.
description.movement: Lower body as one unit until chest nearly touches floor. Press back to start, maintaining rigid plank throughout.
description.cues: Elbows 45 degrees, screw hands into floor, tight core, push floor away

description.overview: A vertical pulling exercise lifting body weight to a bar. The gold standard for upper body pulling strength, targeting lats, biceps, and upper back.
description.setup: Hang from bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulders. Arms fully extended. Core engaged, legs together.
description.movement: Pull body up until chin clears bar. Control descent to full arm extension. Minimize swinging throughout.
description.cues: Pull elbows to ribs, chest to bar, squeeze at top, control the negative

description.overview: A bodyweight squat variation focusing on strength development through controlled tempo and proper form. Builds foundational lower body strength patterns.
description.setup: Feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Arms extended forward for counterbalance. Core braced, chest up.
description.movement: Push hips back and down, knees tracking toes. Descend until thighs parallel or below. Drive through heels to return.
description.cues: Knees out, weight in heels, chest proud, squeeze glutes at top

description.overview: A bodyweight pressing exercise targeting triceps using a bench or chair. Builds arm strength and teaches lockout mechanics for pressing movements.
description.setup: Hands on edge of bench behind you, fingers forward. Legs extended or bent. Shoulders down and back.
description.movement: Lower body by bending elbows to 90 degrees. Press through palms to return to start. Keep elbows tracking backward.
description.cues: Elbows back not out, shoulders away from ears, control the descent, squeeze triceps at top

description.overview: A supine hip extension exercise targeting glutes and hamstrings. Fundamental movement for developing posterior chain strength and teaching hip drive.
description.setup: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat near glutes. Arms at sides. Core engaged, lower back neutral.
description.movement: Drive through heels to lift hips until body forms straight line from knees to shoulders. Squeeze glutes at top. Lower with control.
description.cues: Push floor away with feet, tuck pelvis at top, pause and squeeze, maintain neutral spine

description.overview: A horizontal pushing movement performed lying on a bench, pressing weight from chest to full arm extension. Primary upper body strength exercise targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps.
description.setup: Eyes under bar, shoulder blades pinched, slight arch. Grip wider than shoulders, wrists straight.
description.movement: Unrack with control, lower bar to nipple line with elbows 45°. Pause briefly, press straight up.
description.cues: Pull bar apart, tuck elbows, press yourself into bench, bar travels straight line

description.overview: A hip-hinge movement lifting weight from the floor to hip level in one motion. The king of compound exercises, working nearly every muscle in the body with emphasis on posterior chain.
description.setup: Bar over mid-foot, shins touching bar. Hinge at hips, grab bar outside legs, chest up.
description.movement: Drive legs through floor while pulling chest up. Bar stays close to body. Lock out with glutes, not back.
description.cues: Leg press the floor, drag bar up body, hips through at top, shoulders over bar

description.overview: A fundamental lower body compound movement with barbell on upper back. The king of leg exercises, building strength and mass in quads, glutes, and entire lower body.
description.setup: Bar on upper traps, feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Brace core, chest up, elbows under bar.
description.movement: Push hips back first, knees track over toes. Descend until hip crease below knee. Drive through heels to stand.
description.cues: Big breath and brace, spread the floor, drive hips up, maintain back angle out of hole

description.overview: A vertical pressing movement from shoulders to overhead. Builds functional upper body strength, shoulder stability, and core strength through full-body tension.
description.setup: Bar in front rack, hands just outside shoulders. Elbows slightly forward, core tight, glutes squeezed.
description.movement: Press bar straight up, moving head through as bar passes face. Lock out directly over shoulders. Return with control.
description.cues: Squeeze glutes hard, push head through window, bar path straight, shrug at top

description.overview: A horizontal pulling movement in hinged position. Essential for back development, building thickness through lats, rhomboids, and middle back while strengthening posterior chain.
description.setup: Hinge at hips, bar hanging at arm's length. Back straight, core braced. Grip slightly wider than shoulders.
description.movement: Pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen. Squeeze shoulder blades together. Lower with control maintaining position.
description.cues: Elbows lead the pull, chest proud, squeeze oranges in armpits, maintain hip hinge

description.overview: A hip-hinge movement emphasizing eccentric hamstring strength. Teaches proper hinge mechanics while building posterior chain strength with constant tension.
description.setup: Bar at hip level, feet hip-width apart. Soft knee bend maintained throughout. Shoulders back, lats engaged.
description.movement: Push hips back while lowering bar down legs. Maintain flat back. Feel stretch in hamstrings. Drive hips forward to return.
description.cues: Hips back not down, drag bar down thighs, chest proud, squeeze glutes to finish

description.overview: A loaded hip extension exercise with back supported on bench. The premier glute-building exercise, allowing heavy loading of hip extension pattern.
description.setup: Upper back on bench, bar in hip crease with pad. Feet flat, knees at 90° at top. Chin tucked.
description.movement: Drive through heels to thrust hips up. Achieve full hip extension with posterior pelvic tilt. Lower with control.
description.cues: Drive through heels, ribs down, big squeeze at top, control the negative

description.overview: A unilateral leg exercise with rear foot elevated. Builds single-leg strength, addresses imbalances, and improves hip mobility while challenging balance.
description.setup: Rear foot on bench behind you. Front foot forward in lunge stance. Torso upright, core engaged.
description.movement: Lower straight down bending both knees. Front knee tracks over toes. Drive through front heel to return.
description.cues: Vertical torso, knee tracks toes, push floor away, feel it in front glute

description.overview: An angled pressing movement targeting upper chest. Bridges the gap between flat bench and overhead pressing, building complete chest development.
description.setup: Bench at 30-45° incline. Similar setup to flat bench but bar touches higher on chest. Maintain arch and leg drive.
description.movement: Lower bar to upper chest with control. Press back up and slightly back toward face. Keep shoulder blades retracted.
description.cues: Bar to upper chest, press back not just up, maintain arch, drive feet into floor

description.overview: A powerlifting squat variation with bar positioned on rear delts. Maximizes hip drive and posterior chain involvement, allowing heavier loads than high bar position.
description.setup: Bar on rear delts, wider grip than high bar. More forward lean required. Feet wider, toes out more.
description.movement: Break at hips first with more forward lean. Maintain hip drive throughout. Depth just below parallel. Drive hips forward to stand.
description.cues: Hips back first, maintain back angle, hip drive out of hole, elbows under bar

description.overview: A seated overhead press with legs extended on floor. Eliminates leg drive and lower back compensation, demanding exceptional core strength and shoulder mobility.
description.setup: Sit on floor, legs straight out. Bar in front rack position. Core maximally braced, tall spine.
description.movement: Press bar overhead without leaning back. Maintain upright torso throughout. Lock out directly overhead.
description.cues: Legs straight and together, abs on fire, press straight up, no lean back

description.overview: A squat variation with deliberate pause at bottom position. Builds strength out of the hole, reinforces proper position, and eliminates bounce reflex.
description.setup: Standard squat setup for your preferred style. Mental preparation for pause crucial.
description.movement: Descend with control to bottom position. Hold for 2-3 count maintaining tension. Drive up explosively after pause.
description.cues: Stay tight in pause, count one-thousand-one, explode up, maintain position

description.overview: An explosive overhead press using leg drive for momentum. Builds power, allows heavier loads overhead, and teaches full-body coordination.
description.setup: Bar in front rack, feet hip-width. Elbows slightly forward. Ready to dip and drive.
description.movement: Quick dip by bending knees, explosive drive up. Press out as bar passes forehead. Lock out overhead.
description.cues: Dip straight down, violent hip drive, press through the momentum, quick under bar

description.overview: Pull-ups or chin-ups with added external load. The ultimate test of relative strength, building exceptional back and arm development.
description.setup: Weight belt with plates or dumbbell between feet. Dead hang start, grip of choice.
description.movement: Pull up smoothly without swinging weight. Chin over bar at top. Control the loaded negative.
description.cues: Minimize swing, pull through elbows, squeeze at top, own the negative

description.overview: A dynamic unilateral leg exercise moving forward with each rep. Builds leg strength, improves balance, and enhances functional movement patterns.
description.setup: Standing tall, weights at sides or in front rack. Core engaged, eyes forward.
description.movement: Step forward into lunge, both knees to 90°. Drive through front heel to step forward. Alternate legs.
description.cues: Long steps, vertical torso, knee tracks toe, push through front heel

description.overview: A lunge variation crossing back leg behind like a curtsy. Targets glutes and outer thighs while challenging balance and hip mobility.
description.setup: Standing with weights, feet hip-width. Core tight for balance.
description.movement: Step one leg back and across behind other leg. Lower into curtsy position. Drive up through front leg.
description.cues: Cross behind not just back, feel outer glute, keep hips square, control the motion

description.overview: A side-stepping lunge targeting adductors and glutes. Builds lateral strength and mobility often neglected in sagittal plane movements.
description.setup: Wide stance start or step out wide. Weights at chest or sides. Toes slightly out.
description.movement: Shift weight to one side, bending that knee. Other leg stays straight. Push back to start.
description.cues: Sit back into hip, straight leg stays straight, push through bent leg, chest up

description.overview: A ballistic hip hinge movement using momentum. The king of posterior chain power exercises, building explosive hip drive and conditioning.
description.setup: Feet wider than shoulders, kettlebell arm's length front. Hinge to grab handle, shoulders back.
description.movement: Hike kettlebell back between legs. Explosive hip drive forward. Float kettlebell to shoulder height. Repeat rhythm.
description.cues: Hips do the work, float don't lift, snap hips, breathing matches rhythm

description.overview: Olympic-style squat with bar high on traps. Emphasizes quadriceps development with upright torso position, allowing deeper range of motion.
description.setup: Bar on upper traps, narrower grip. Feet shoulder-width, moderate toe angle. Upright torso position.
description.movement: Descend straight down between legs. Maintain upright torso. Hit maximum depth. Drive straight up.
description.cues: Elbows under bar, knees forward is OK, bounce out of hole, stay upright

description.overview: A squat variation with bar in front rack position. Demands tremendous core strength and thoracic mobility while maximizing quadriceps activation.
description.setup: Bar in front rack, elbows high. Clean grip or cross-arm grip. Feet slightly narrower than back squat.
description.movement: Descend straight down maintaining high elbows. Extreme upright position required. Drive up maintaining rack position.
description.cues: Elbows up up up, sit straight down, abs on fire, drive straight up

description.overview: Squat using safety squat bar with handles. Combines benefits of front and back squat, easier on shoulders while challenging upper back.
description.setup: Bar sits on traps with pad, hold handles forward. More upright than low bar. Feet at preferred width.
description.movement: Descend with slight forward lean. Handles pull you forward, fight to stay upright. Drive up maintaining position.
description.cues: Fight the forward pull, big breath and brace, maintain tightness, push the floor

description.overview: Squat to seated position on box before standing. Teaches proper depth, eliminates stretch reflex, and builds explosive strength from dead stop.
description.setup: Box at parallel or below, bar position of choice. Wider stance typically used. Vertical shins goal.
description.movement: Sit back to box maintaining tension. Brief pause without relaxing. Explode up from static position.
description.cues: Sit back not down, stay tight on box, explode off box, vertical shins

description.overview: A rehabilitation exercise targeting VMO and terminal knee extension. Builds strength in final degrees of extension, crucial for knee health.
description.setup: Band around knee, anchored behind. Slight knee bend start position. Weight on working leg.
description.movement: Extend knee fully against band resistance. Hold brief contraction. Return to slight bend. Focus on VMO.
description.cues: Full extension, squeeze quad hard, feel inside knee, controlled tempo

description.overview: A unilateral exercise stepping onto elevated surface. Builds single-leg strength, addresses imbalances, and mimics real-world movement patterns.
description.setup: Box at knee height or below. Full foot on box. Weights at sides or front rack.
description.movement: Drive through elevated foot to stand on box. Control the descent. Minimal push from bottom leg.
description.cues: Push through top foot, control down, no bouncing, full foot on box

description.overview: An isolation exercise for calf development. Targets gastrocnemius and soleus muscles through plantar flexion movement pattern.
description.setup: Balls of feet on edge or block. Heels hanging off. Weight in hands or on shoulders.
description.movement: Rise up onto toes as high as possible. Pause at peak contraction. Lower slowly for stretch.
description.cues: Full range of motion, pause at top, slow negative, feel the stretch

description.overview: A rotational core exercise performed in V-sit position. Builds oblique strength and rotational power for athletic performance.
description.setup: Seated, lean back to V position. Feet elevated or grounded. Weight held at chest.
description.movement: Rotate weight side to side, touching ground. Maintain V position throughout. Control the rotation speed.
description.cues: Chest follows weight, maintain V angle, breathe through rotation, control tempo

description.overview: A lunge variation stepping backward instead of forward. Easier on knees than forward lunges while effectively targeting quads and glutes.
description.setup: Standing tall, weights at sides or front rack. Core engaged for balance.
description.movement: Step back into lunge position. Both knees to 90 degrees. Drive through front heel to return.
description.cues: Step back far enough, vertical torso, push through front heel, control the movement

description.overview: A combination plank and row exercise. Builds anti-rotation core strength while developing back, challenging total body stability.
description.setup: High plank position with hands on dumbbells. Wide foot stance for stability. Rigid body position.
description.movement: Row one dumbbell to hip while maintaining plank. Resist rotation. Lower with control. Alternate sides.
description.cues: Hips stay level, pull elbow high, fight rotation, breathe through reps

description.overview: A squat variation loading weight through hips via belt. Removes spinal loading while maximizing leg development, ideal for back-friendly training.
description.setup: Belt around hips, attached to load. Wide stance typical. Hands for balance only.
description.movement: Squat down allowing knees to track naturally. No spinal load to manage. Drive up through legs only.
description.cues: Sit back and down, let knees travel, feel it in legs only, use full range

description.overview: A stationary lunge position exercise. Builds unilateral strength in stable position, excellent for addressing imbalances and building leg strength.
description.setup: Split stance, back foot on toes. Front shin vertical at bottom. Weights at sides or front rack.
description.movement: Lower straight down, both knees to 90°. Drive through front heel to rise. Stay in split stance throughout.
description.cues: Vertical drop, weight on front leg, back leg for balance, controlled tempo

description.overview: A bench press with mandatory pause on chest. Competition standard movement eliminating bounce, building strength through full range.
description.setup: Standard bench press setup. Mental preparation for pause. Judge's commands in competition.
description.movement: Lower bar with control to chest. Hold complete pause. Press on command or after count. No heaving.
description.cues: Sink the bar, stay tight in pause, press command, maintain arch

description.overview: A bench press variation with narrow grip. Emphasizes triceps development while maintaining chest involvement, excellent for lockout strength.
description.setup: Grip inside shoulder width, index fingers on smooth. Same bench setup otherwise. Elbows tucked more.
description.movement: Lower bar to lower chest position. Elbows stay close to body. Press straight up focusing on triceps.
description.cues: Elbows in tight, bar lower on chest, triceps do work, control the weight

description.overview: A bench press stopping 2-3 inches above chest. Eliminates stretch reflex and builds strength in sticking point, named after champion powerlifter.
description.setup: Standard bench setup. Spotter recommended for safety. Mental cue for stopping point.
description.movement: Lower bar stopping 2-3 inches from chest. Pause briefly. Press from dead stop. Never touch chest.
description.cues: Stop above chest, no bounce available, pause and press, constant tension

description.overview: A hybrid between close-grip bench and tricep extension. Maximizes triceps involvement while maintaining heavy loading potential.
description.setup: Close grip on bar, lying on bench. Bar starts over lower chest. Elbows will travel forward.
description.movement: Lower bar toward face/neck while elbows drift forward. Reverse to press back over lower chest.
description.cues: Elbows forward, bar to face, press back not up, feel massive tricep stretch

description.overview: High-intensity combination exercise performed for time. Builds cardiovascular fitness and full-body strength endurance.
description.setup: Dumbbells at shoulders in athletic stance. Ready for continuous movement during timed intervals.
description.movement: Squat down, drive up explosively pressing dumbbells overhead. Continuous rhythm for prescribed time.
description.cues: Smooth transitions, use leg drive, breathe with movement, maintain pace under fatigue

description.overview: High-intensity cardio exercise in plank position performed for time intervals. Builds conditioning, core strength, and mental toughness through sustained effort.
description.setup: High plank position, ready for rapid leg movement. Mental prep for sustained intensity.
description.movement: Drive knees to chest alternately at maximum sustainable pace. Maintain plank integrity throughout interval.
description.cues: Quick feet, hips low, breathe steadily, push through burn

description.overview: Push-ups performed in Tabata protocol (20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest, 8 rounds). Builds muscular endurance.
description.setup: Standard push-up position. Mental preparation for 8 rounds of maximum effort work.
description.movement: Maximum push-ups for 20 seconds, rest 10 seconds. Repeat 8 times. Maintain form under fatigue.
description.cues: All-out effort, quick rest, form over speed when tired, embrace the burn

description.overview: High-intensity burpees with specified rep counts and rest periods. Ultimate conditioning exercise building total-body power endurance.
description.setup: Clear space for explosive movement. Mental preparation for high-intensity work.
description.movement: Complete prescribed burpee reps explosively. Rest as indicated. Maintain quality through fatigue.
description.cues: Explosive reps, full range, quick transitions, earn your rest

description.overview: Three different cardio machines performed in sequence for time. Builds aerobic capacity through varied movement patterns preventing adaptation.
description.setup: Three stations ready - typically stair master, rower, assault bike. Quick transitions planned.
description.movement: 5 minutes hard effort each station. Minimal transition time. Sustained effort throughout 15 minutes.
description.cues: Steady pace, smooth transitions, different muscles each station, finish strong

description.overview: Explosive kettlebell swings performed for specific rep counts with timed rest. Builds posterior chain power endurance and grip strength.
description.setup: Kettlebell ready, athletic stance. Breathing pattern established for work periods.
description.movement: Explosive swings for prescribed reps. Rest as indicated. Maintain hip snap throughout all intervals.
description.cues: Aggressive hip snap, float the bell, breathe at top, own every rep

description.overview: A hip abduction exercise performed side-lying. Activates glute medius and hip stabilizers, essential for knee health and movement preparation.
description.setup: Side-lying, knees bent 90°, heels together. Band around knees for resistance. Head supported, core engaged.
description.movement: Rotate top knee up while keeping heels together. Feel glute activation. Lower with control. Maintain neutral spine.
description.cues: Heels stay together, pure rotation, feel side glute, no rocking back

description.overview: A quadruped hip abduction exercise mimicking a dog at hydrant. Activates glutes and hip stabilizers while challenging core stability.
description.setup: All fours position, hands under shoulders, knees under hips. Neutral spine, core engaged.
description.movement: Lift one knee out to side maintaining 90° angle. Hip height only. Lower with control. Keep hips level.
description.cues: Hips stay square, knee to hip height, resist rotation, controlled tempo

description.overview: A supine core stability exercise with reciprocal limb movement. Teaches core control while moving limbs, essential for spinal stability.
description.setup: Lie on back, arms reaching up, knees bent 90° over hips. Lower back pressed into floor.
description.movement: Lower opposite arm and leg toward floor. Maintain back contact. Return to start. Alternate sides.
description.cues: Back stays flat, slow and controlled, breathe throughout, opposite arm and leg

description.overview: A quadruped exercise extending opposite arm and leg. Builds core stability, balance, and posterior chain coordination.
description.setup: All fours, hands under shoulders, knees under hips. Neutral spine maintained throughout.
description.movement: Extend opposite arm forward and leg back simultaneously. Hold briefly. Return with control. Alternate.
description.cues: Long and strong, hips level, reach through limbs, no arching back

description.overview: A standing hip hinge mobility drill targeting hamstrings and lower back. Teaches proper hinge mechanics while improving posterior chain flexibility and control.
description.setup: Stand with feet hip-width apart, slight bend in knees. Hands clasped behind back or at sides. Core engaged, chest proud.
description.movement: Hinge at hips, pushing them back while keeping spine neutral. Lower torso until stretch is felt in hamstrings. Return to standing by driving hips forward.
description.cues: Push hips back not down, flat back throughout, soft knees, squeeze glutes to stand

description.overview: A core exercise lifting legs while supine. Targets lower abs and hip flexors while challenging anti-extension strength.
description.setup: Lie on back, legs straight, hands at sides or under glutes. Lower back pressed down.
description.movement: Raise straight legs to vertical position. Lower with control without touching floor. Maintain back contact.
description.cues: Back stays flat, control the negative, legs straight, breathe out on lift

description.overview: A core exercise lifting legs while hanging from a pull up bar. Targets lower abs and hip flexors while challenging anti-extension strength.
description.setup: Hang from pull-up bar with shoulder-width grip. Engage core, avoid swinging.
description.movement: Raise straight legs to horizontal or higher. Lower with control without swinging. Maintain tight core.
description.cues: No swinging, control the negative, legs straight, breathe out on lift

description.overview: Dynamic full-body mobility exercise walking hands forward from standing. Builds flexibility, core strength, and serves as excellent warm-up.
description.setup: Standing tall, feet hip-width. Ready to hinge forward and walk out.
description.movement: Hinge to touch floor, walk hands to plank. Optional push-up. Walk feet to hands. Stand up. Repeat.
description.cues: Keep legs straight as able, strong plank position, controlled movement, feel the stretch

description.overview: A wide-stance deadlift variation emphasizing quads and glutes. Reduces range of motion and back stress while maximizing hip and leg drive.
description.setup: Wide stance with toes pointed out. Grip inside legs. Hips closer to bar than conventional. Chest up, knees out.
description.movement: Drive floor apart with feet while pulling chest up. Keep bar close. Lock out hips and knees simultaneously.
description.cues: Spread the floor, knees track toes, patient off floor, hips and shoulders rise together

description.overview: Deadlift performed from elevated platform increasing range of motion. Builds strength off the floor and improves starting position mechanics.
description.setup: Stand on 1-4 inch platform. Standard deadlift setup otherwise. Extra attention to starting position.
description.movement: Same as regular deadlift but from deficit. Increased leg drive required. Maintain position through extended range.
description.cues: Extra tight setup, more leg drive, maintain back angle, be patient

description.overview: Partial deadlift from elevated position in power rack. Allows heavier loading for lockout strength and back development.
description.setup: Bar in rack at knee level or above. Standard deadlift grip and stance. Big breath before pull.
description.movement: Pull from pins to lockout. Focus on hip drive and back strength. Control the eccentric to pins.
description.cues: Drive hips through, big lats, controlled negative, heavy but perfect

description.overview: A cable exercise pulling weight down to chest. Primary lat builder allowing heavy loading with stability, excellent for building width.
description.setup: Grip slightly wider than shoulders. Slight lean back. Chest up, shoulder blades down.
description.movement: Pull bar to upper chest squeezing lats. Control the stretch at top. Maintain torso angle throughout.
description.cues: Pull with elbows, squeeze lats hard, chest to bar, control the negative

description.overview: Horizontal pulling exercise using cable station. Builds back thickness with constant tension throughout range of motion.
description.setup: Seated with knees slightly bent. Handle at arm's length. Upright torso, shoulders back.
description.movement: Pull handle to abdomen keeping elbows close. Squeeze shoulder blades. Control the return maintaining position.
description.cues: Sit tall, pull to belly button, squeeze the middle back, stretch but stay tight

description.overview: An isolation exercise for chest using arc motion. Provides deep stretch and peak contraction focusing on pec development.
description.setup: Dumbbells above chest, slight elbow bend maintained. Shoulder blades retracted, feet planted.
description.movement: Lower weights in wide arc until chest stretch felt. Return in same arc path squeezing chest.
description.cues: Wide arc not press, feel the stretch, hug a tree motion, control heavy weights

description.overview: Cable exercise pulling rope to face level. Builds rear delts and upper back while improving posture and shoulder health.
description.setup: Rope at face height, arms extended. Step back for tension. Athletic stance for stability.
description.movement: Pull rope to face spreading hands apart. Elbows high. Squeeze upper back. Control return.
description.cues: Elbows high, pull apart at face, squeeze between shoulders, perfect posture

description.overview: Sumo deadlift performed from elevated platform. Combines wider stance benefits with increased range of motion for maximum posterior chain development.
description.setup: Stand on 1-4 inch platform with wide sumo stance. Toes out, grip inside legs. Extra attention to start position.
description.movement: Drive feet apart while pulling up from deeper position. Extra quad and glute drive required. Maintain sumo positioning.
description.cues: Spread the floor, patient from deficit, knees out, longer range means more work

description.overview: Deadlift from blocks at various heights. Allows focus on specific range of motion and lockout strength development.
description.setup: Barbell resting on blocks at desired height (typically 2-4 inches). Standard deadlift stance and grip.
description.movement: Pull from block height to full lockout. Focus on lockout strength and upper back development. Control return to blocks.
description.cues: Big back arch, drive hips through, own the lockout, controlled negative

description.overview: Deadlift with pause at mid-shin or knee level. Builds strength through sticking points and eliminates momentum.
description.setup: Standard deadlift setup. Mental preparation for pause position. Usually paused at mid-shin.
description.movement: Pull to pause position and hold for 2-3 seconds. Continue to lockout after pause. Eliminates bounce reflex.
description.cues: Stay tight in pause, maintain position, drive through after pause, no relaxing

description.overview: Stiff-leg deadlift emphasizing hamstring flexibility and strength. Legs remain straighter than Romanian deadlift for maximum hamstring stretch.
description.setup: Feet hip-width, legs as straight as flexibility allows. Bar starts at hip level or on blocks.
description.movement: Hinge at hips keeping legs straight. Lower until maximum hamstring stretch. Drive hips forward to return.
description.cues: Legs stay straight, feel massive hamstring stretch, chest proud, hips back and through

description.overview: Deadlift using thick axle bar. Builds tremendous grip strength and core stability while challenging conventional deadlift technique.
description.setup: Standard deadlift stance with thick axle bar. Grip will be challenged significantly. Core must be extra tight.
description.movement: Same deadlift mechanics but with compromised grip. Focus on maintaining position despite grip fatigue.
description.cues: Squeeze bar hard, core stays tight, don't let bar slip, shorter sets due to grip

description.overview: Deadlift with chains adding accommodating resistance. Weight increases as bar rises, maximizing lockout strength development.
description.setup: Chains draped over barbell so some links touch floor at bottom. Standard deadlift setup otherwise.
description.movement: Pull with increasing resistance as chains lift off floor. Maximum resistance at lockout. Focus on explosive finish.
description.cues: Accelerate through the pull, finish hard at top, chains make it harder as you go up

description.overview: Standing overhead press with no leg drive. Pure upper body pressing strength, maximum shoulder and core development.
description.setup: Bar in front rack, feet planted, core maximally braced. No leg movement allowed.
description.movement: Press straight up using only upper body. No leg drive, hip thrust, or back lean. Pure shoulder strength.
description.cues: No leg help, core stays tight, bar straight up, control the weight

description.overview: Dumbbell overhead press variation. Allows natural movement path and addresses strength imbalances between arms.
description.setup: Dumbbells at shoulder height, standing or seated. Core engaged, slight stagger stance if standing.
description.movement: Press dumbbells overhead in slight arc motion. Weights come together at top. Control descent.
description.cues: Natural arc path, core stays braced, weights meet at top, smooth control

description.overview: Overhead press performed seated to eliminate leg drive. Isolates shoulders and triceps while requiring core stability.
description.setup: Seated on bench with back support. Bar in front rack position. Feet planted for stability.
description.movement: Press bar overhead without back support if possible. Focus purely on shoulder strength. Control the descent.
description.cues: No leg help, sit tall, press straight up, core engaged

description.overview: Seated dumbbell overhead press with back support. Beginner-friendly shoulder exercise with stability assistance.
description.setup: Seated on bench with back support. Dumbbells at shoulder height. Feet planted firmly.
description.movement: Press dumbbells overhead with back support assistance. Focus on feeling shoulders work. Control the weight.
description.cues: Use the back support, feel shoulders working, control both weights, steady breathing

description.overview: Bent-over row with strict form eliminating body English. Pure back strength development without momentum assistance.
description.setup: Hinge position with knees soft. Bar hanging at arm's length. Strict position maintained throughout.
description.movement: Row bar to lower chest with zero body movement. Pure back and arm strength. Squeeze hard at top.
description.cues: No body English, pure back strength, squeeze hard, maintain position

description.overview: Bent-over row allowing controlled body English for heavier loading. Builds strength and allows overload beyond strict capacity.
description.setup: Athletic position ready to use slight body movement. Heavier weight than strict rows.
description.movement: Row with controlled hip drive and slight momentum. Still focus on back muscles but allow some assistance.
description.cues: Controlled cheating, still feel the back, hip helps the pull, heavier than strict

description.overview: Bent-over row with underhand grip emphasizing biceps and lower lats. Changes muscle recruitment pattern from overhand grip.
description.setup: Bent-over position with underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart. Slightly different pulling angle.
description.movement: Row bar to lower abdomen with underhand grip. Feel different muscle activation. Biceps more involved.
description.cues: Underhand changes everything, feel the biceps help, pull to belly, squeeze and hold

description.overview: Rowing exercise with chest support eliminating lower back stress. Allows pure back focus without posterior chain fatigue.
description.setup: Incline bench set to 45 degrees. Chest against pad, dumbbells hanging down. Stable base for rowing.
description.movement: Row dumbbells to sides of bench. Chest stays in contact with pad. Pure back and arm movement.
description.cues: Chest stays down, pull to bench level, squeeze shoulder blades, no momentum

description.overview: V-handle row using barbell or T-bar apparatus. Excellent for building back thickness with heavy loading potential.
description.setup: Straddle bar or T-bar, bent over position. V-handle or close grip. Athletic stance for stability.
description.movement: Row handle to stomach area. Focus on pulling elbows back. Strong contraction between shoulder blades.
description.cues: Elbows lead the pull, handle to stomach, big squeeze between shoulders, control the weight

description.overview: Barbell press on inclined bench targeting upper chest. Combines benefits of flat bench with upper chest emphasis.
description.setup: Bench at 30-45 degree incline. Similar grip to flat bench. Eyes under bar, shoulder blades pinched.
description.movement: Lower bar to upper chest, press back and slightly up. Different angle requires adjusted bar path.
description.cues: Bar to upper chest, press back and up, feel upper chest working, maintain arch

description.overview: Chest pressing movement using cables for constant tension. Allows various angles and provides different feel than free weights.
description.setup: Cables at chest height, step forward for tension. Athletic stance, core engaged for stability.
description.movement: Press handles forward and slightly together. Feel constant tension throughout range. Control the return.
description.cues: Constant tension, press and squeeze, feel it throughout, control the stretch

description.overview: Isolation exercise for lateral deltoids. The gold standard for building shoulder width and medial delt development.
description.setup: Dumbbells at sides, slight forward lean. Elbows slightly bent throughout. Light weight, perfect form.
description.movement: Raise weights out to sides to shoulder height. Lead with elbows, not hands. Control negative phase.
description.cues: Lead with elbows, pour water at top, slow negative, feel the burn, light weight

description.overview: Isolation exercise for front deltoids. Builds anterior shoulder strength and balances pressing movements.
description.setup: Dumbbells in front of thighs, standing tall. Slight bend in elbows maintained throughout movement.
description.movement: Raise one or both weights to shoulder height in front. Control the movement both ways. Focus on front delts.
description.cues: Controlled raise, feel front delts, to shoulder height, resist the drop

description.overview: Tricep isolation exercise using cable machine. Excellent for building tricep mass and learning lockout mechanics.
description.setup: Cable at head height, rope or bar attachment. Elbows at sides, standing tall with slight lean forward.
description.movement: Push weight down by extending elbows only. Squeeze triceps hard at bottom. Control the return.
description.cues: Elbows stay put, push down hard, squeeze at bottom, control the negative

description.overview: Tricep exercise with arms overhead targeting long head. Provides deep stretch and strong contraction for tricep development.
description.setup: Dumbbell or cable overhead, elbows pointing forward. Core engaged to prevent back arch.
description.movement: Lower weight behind head by bending elbows only. Feel tricep stretch. Extend back to start.
description.cues: Elbows forward, deep stretch, only elbows move, strong contraction at top

description.overview: Push-up variation with hands in diamond shape. Emphasizes triceps and inner chest while building pushing strength.
description.setup: High plank with hands forming diamond shape under chest. Body straight from head to heels.
description.movement: Lower chest to hands maintaining diamond shape. Press back up focusing on triceps. Keep body rigid.
description.cues: Diamond stays put, chest to hands, feel triceps working, rigid body line

description.overview: Pull-ups with added external load. The ultimate upper body pulling strength exercise for advanced trainees.
description.setup: Weight belt with plates or dumbbell between feet. Dead hang start position. Grip of choice.
description.movement: Pull body and weight up until chin clears bar. Control loaded descent. Maintain strict form.
description.cues: Control the extra weight, chin over bar, own the negative, strict form only

description.overview: High cable row targeting upper back and rear delts. Excellent for posture improvement and building upper back thickness.
description.setup: Cable at face height or above. Wide grip or rope attachment. Step back for tension.
description.movement: Pull cable to upper chest/face level. Elbows high throughout movement. Squeeze upper back hard.
description.cues: Elbows high, pull to face, squeeze upper back, retract shoulder blades

description.overview: Vertical pulling exercise targeting shoulders and traps. Builds shoulder width and trap development with upward pulling motion.
description.setup: Barbell or dumbbells at arm's length. Narrow grip, standing tall. Core engaged for stability.
description.movement: Pull weight straight up to chest level, leading with elbows. Keep weight close to body. Control descent.
description.cues: Elbows lead, weight stays close, pull to chest, feel shoulders and traps

description.overview: Rear delt isolation exercise performed bent over. Essential for shoulder health and balancing pressing movements.
description.setup: Bent forward 45 degrees, dumbbells hanging down. Light weight, arms slightly bent throughout.
description.movement: Raise weights out to sides in reverse fly motion. Focus on rear delts and rhomboids. Squeeze between shoulders.
description.cues: Light weight, bent forward, feel rear delts, squeeze between shoulders, control both ways

description.overview: Push-up variation in pike position targeting shoulders. Progression toward handstand push-ups while building shoulder strength.
description.setup: Downward dog position, hands shoulder-width apart. Higher pike for more difficulty.
description.movement: Lower head toward hands by bending elbows. Press back to start. Feel shoulders working hard.
description.cues: High pike position, head toward hands, shoulders do the work, controlled movement

description.overview: Full-body exercise combining squat and press using cables. Builds functional strength and coordination.
description.setup: Cable handles at shoulder height. Step back for tension. Feet shoulder-width apart.
description.movement: Squat down while handles stay at shoulders. Drive up and press handles overhead. Fluid combination.
description.cues: Smooth transition, use leg drive for press, handles follow body, controlled tempo

description.overview: Unilateral row using landmine setup. Provides unique angle and challenges core stability while building back strength.
description.setup: Barbell in landmine, staggered stance. One hand on bar, other hand on hip or thigh for support.
description.movement: Row barbell to side of body with anti-rotation focus. Feel lat and core working together.
description.cues: Don't rotate, feel the lat, core stays tight, row to hip level

description.overview: Ballistic hip hinge using kettlebell. Premier posterior chain power exercise building explosive hip drive.
description.setup: Feet wider than shoulders, kettlebell arm's length away. Athletic position ready for explosive movement.
description.movement: Hike bell back between legs, explosive hip snap forward. Bell floats to shoulder height. Rhythm crucial.
description.cues: Explosive hips, float don't lift, snap like whip, breathing with rhythm

description.overview: Complex full-body movement from floor to standing with weight overhead. Ultimate stability and strength challenge.
description.setup: Lying on back with kettlebell locked out overhead. Opposite leg bent, same side leg straight.
description.movement: Rise to standing through series of positions keeping weight overhead. Reverse to return to floor.
description.cues: Eyes on weight, slow and controlled, strong overhead position, master each position

description.overview: Front squat to overhead press in one movement. High-intensity exercise building full-body power and conditioning.
description.setup: Weight in front rack position, feet shoulder-width. Ready for explosive transition from squat to press.
description.movement: Front squat down, drive up explosively using momentum to press weight overhead. One fluid motion.
description.cues: Use the bounce, fluid transition, explode up, full lockout overhead

description.overview: Burpee followed by box jump combining conditioning with explosive power. Advanced full-body conditioning exercise.
description.setup: Standing in front of box at appropriate height. Clear space for burpee movement.
description.movement: Perform burpee, then immediately explode up onto box. Step down and repeat. Maximum intensity.
description.cues: Explosive transition, land softly on box, step down don't jump, high intensity throughout

description.overview: Dynamic movement from plank to downward dog position. Builds core strength, shoulder mobility, and hamstring flexibility.
description.setup: Start in high plank position. Hands shoulder-width apart, body straight from head to heels.
description.movement: Push hips up and back into downward dog position. Return to plank. Feel core and shoulders working.
description.cues: Strong plank start, push hips high, feel hamstring stretch, controlled transitions

description.overview: Core exercise reaching for toes from V-sit position. Targets rectus abdominis and hip flexors with dynamic movement.
description.setup: V-sit position with legs extended and hands reaching forward. Balance on tailbone.
description.movement: Reach hands toward toes while maintaining V position. Crunch forward and extend back. Keep legs straight.
description.cues: Reach for toes, maintain V position, legs stay straight, rhythmic movement

description.overview: Goblet squat using cable for constant tension. Combines benefits of goblet position with accommodating resistance.
description.setup: Cable handle held at chest height. Feet slightly wider than shoulders, toes out.
description.movement: Squat down maintaining handle at chest. Drive up against cable resistance. Constant tension throughout.
description.cues: Handle stays at chest, squat between legs, constant tension, drive through heels

description.overview: Lunge stepping backward instead of forward. Knee-friendly alternative providing excellent quad and glute development.
description.setup: Standing tall with weights at sides or front rack. Core engaged for balance.
description.movement: Step back into lunge position. Both knees to 90 degrees. Drive through front heel to return.
description.cues: Step back, not down, front knee tracks toe, drive through front heel, controlled movement

description.overview: Explosive jump onto elevated platform. Develops lower body power, rate of force development, and athletic performance.
description.setup: Standing arm's length from box. Arms back ready to swing. Focus on landing spot.
description.movement: Swing arms and jump explosively onto box. Land softly in squat position. Step down with control.
description.cues: Explosive takeoff, soft landing, step down don't jump, reset between reps

description.overview: Isolated quadriceps exercise using machine. Builds quad strength and size while targeting all four heads.
description.setup: Seated in machine with back against pad. Ankles under roller pad, knees aligned with pivot.
description.movement: Extend legs by contracting quadriceps. Squeeze hard at top. Lower with control resisting weight.
description.cues: Squeeze quads hard, full extension, pause at top, control the negative

description.overview: Unilateral glute bridge challenging single-leg strength. Addresses imbalances while building glute and hamstring strength.
description.setup: Lying on back, one foot planted, other leg extended or bent up. Arms at sides for stability.
description.movement: Drive through planted heel to lift hips up. Squeeze glute hard at top. Lower with control.
description.cues: Drive through heel, big glute squeeze, hips stay level, feel the working side

description.overview: Side-stepping with band resistance targeting hip abductors. Essential for knee health and glute activation.
description.setup: Band around knees or ankles. Athletic stance with slight squat position. Core engaged.
description.movement: Step sideways maintaining tension in band. Keep knees out and hips back. Small controlled steps.
description.cues: Maintain squat position, knees stay out, feel glutes working, controlled steps

description.overview: Bodyweight side-stepping exercise for hip stability. Activates glutes and improves lateral movement patterns.
description.setup: Athletic stance, slight squat position. Hands on hips or out for balance.
description.movement: Step sideways while maintaining squat position. Keep hips back and knees out. Focus on glute activation.
description.cues: Stay in squat, step don't shuffle, feel glutes, maintain good posture

description.overview: Fundamental bodyweight squat movement. Foundation exercise for all squatting patterns and lower body strength.
description.setup: Feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Arms extended forward for balance. Core engaged.
description.movement: Sit back and down until thighs parallel or below. Drive through heels to stand. Keep chest up.
description.cues: Sit back first, knees track toes, chest proud, drive through heels

description.overview: Isometric squat hold against wall. Builds muscular endurance in quadriceps and glutes while teaching proper position.
description.setup: Back against wall, walk feet out until thighs parallel. Arms crossed or at sides.
description.movement: Hold squat position against wall. Maintain 90-degree knee angle. Breathe normally throughout hold.
description.cues: Press back into wall, thighs parallel, breathe normally, fight the burn

description.overview: Explosive bodyweight squat with jump. Develops power and athleticism while improving squat mechanics under fatigue.
description.setup: Feet shoulder-width apart in squat stance. Arms ready for momentum assistance.
description.movement: Squat down and explode up jumping as high as possible. Land softly back into squat. Continuous rhythm.
description.cues: Explode up, reach for ceiling, soft landing, continuous rhythm, maintain form

description.overview: Dynamic plank variation adding leg movement. Combines core stability with cardiovascular challenge and coordination.
description.setup: High plank position with feet together. Hands directly under shoulders, body straight.
description.movement: Jump feet apart and together while maintaining plank position. Keep hips level and core tight.
description.cues: Hips stay level, quick feet, maintain plank, breathe with movement

description.overview: Isolation exercise targeting glutes using cable or band. Builds glute strength and activation in hip extension.
description.setup: Cable or band around ankle. Hold support for balance. Standing leg slightly bent.
description.movement: Kick working leg straight back focusing on glute contraction. Control return. Keep hips square.
description.cues: Glutes do the work, hips stay square, straight leg, squeeze at back

description.overview: Glute bridge with band resistance around knees. Adds abduction component while building glute strength.
description.setup: Lying on back with band around knees. Feet flat, knees bent. Arms at sides.
description.movement: Drive hips up while pushing knees out against band. Feel glutes working hard. Lower with control.
description.cues: Push knees out, hips drive up, squeeze glutes hard, fight the band

description.overview: Front-loaded squat holding weight at chest. Excellent teaching tool and effective leg exercise.
description.setup: Weight held at chest, elbows pointing down. Feet slightly wider than shoulders.
description.movement: Squat down between legs with elbows tracking inside knees. Drive through heels to stand.
description.cues: Elbows between knees, sit between legs, weight stays at chest, heels down

description.overview: Bent-over rowing using dumbbells for back development. Allows unilateral focus and natural movement path.
description.setup: Bent over at hips, dumbbells hanging down. Back straight, core engaged for stability.
description.movement: Row dumbbells to hips/lower chest. Focus on lat and rhomboid contraction. Control the stretch.
description.cues: Row to hips, squeeze back muscles, maintain bent position, control the weights

description.overview: Dumbbell pressing on inclined bench targeting upper chest. Combines incline angle benefits with dumbbell advantages.
description.setup: Incline bench at 30-45 degrees. Dumbbells at chest level. Shoulder blades retracted.
description.movement: Press dumbbells up and together in arc motion. Lower to chest level feeling upper chest stretch.
description.cues: Feel upper chest, arc motion, deeper stretch than barbell, control the weights

description.overview: Wide-stance squat emphasizing inner thighs and glutes. Allows deeper range of motion and targets different muscle emphasis.
description.setup: Wide stance with toes pointed out significantly. Weight at chest or hanging down. Core engaged.
description.movement: Squat down between legs tracking knees over toes. Drive through heels focusing on glutes and inner thighs.
description.cues: Wide stance, toes out, knees track toes, feel glutes and inner thighs, deep range

description.overview: Supine hip extension exercise targeting glutes and hamstrings. Foundation movement for hip drive and glute development.
description.setup: Lying on back, knees bent, feet flat. Arms at sides for stability. Core engaged.
description.movement: Drive hips up by squeezing glutes. Create straight line from knees to shoulders. Lower with control.
description.cues: Squeeze glutes hard, hips drive up, straight line, pause at top, control down

description.overview: Squat with wider than normal stance. Emphasizes glutes and adductors while allowing different loading patterns.
description.setup: Feet wider than normal squat stance, toes pointed out. Bar position of choice.
description.movement: Squat down tracking knees over toes. Focus on sitting back and spreading the floor. Drive up through heels.
description.cues: Spread the floor, knees out, sit back, feel glutes and inner thighs

description.overview: Squat with closer than normal stance. Emphasizes quadriceps development and requires greater ankle mobility.
description.setup: Feet closer together than normal squat. May require more upright torso. Bar position of choice.
description.movement: Squat down maintaining narrow stance. Knees travel more forward. Drive up through mid-foot.
description.cues: Narrow stance, knees forward is OK, feel quads working, maintain balance

description.overview: Squat using cambered Duffalo bar. Provides different feel and may be easier on shoulders while challenging stability.
description.setup: Duffalo bar on upper back. May feel different than straight bar. Standard squat stance.
description.movement: Squat with cambered bar feeling different balance demands. Maintain control throughout range.
description.cues: Feel the different balance, control the camber, maintain position, use the flexibility

description.overview: Split stance lunge movement. Fundamental unilateral exercise building leg strength and addressing imbalances.
description.setup: Starting position with weight of choice. Step forward or back into lunge position.
description.movement: Lower into lunge with both knees to 90 degrees. Drive through front heel to return or step into next rep.
description.cues: Both knees to 90, front knee tracks toe, drive through front heel, controlled descent

description.overview: Lunge variation using safety squat bar with handles. Provides stability assistance while challenging legs unilaterally.
description.setup: SSB across upper back with handles forward. Step into lunge position. Bar may want to pull forward.
description.movement: Perform lunge while controlling bar position. Handles help with balance. Drive through front heel to return.
description.cues: Control the bar, handles help balance, feel front leg working, stable torso

description.overview: Squat holding onto safety bars or uprights for support. Allows heavy leg loading while reducing balance demands.
description.setup: Bar on back, hands holding safety bars or uprights. Feet positioned for comfortable squat.
description.movement: Squat down using hands for balance assistance only. Focus purely on leg strength. Drive up through legs.
description.cues: Hands for balance only, legs do the work, full range of motion, control the weight

description.overview: Standard horizontal barbell press on flat bench. The gold standard for upper body pressing strength and chest development.
description.setup: Eyes under bar, shoulder blades retracted, feet planted. Grip slightly wider than shoulders.
description.movement: Lower bar to nipple line with control. Pause briefly on chest. Press straight up maintaining position.
description.cues: Bar to nipples, pause on chest, press straight up, maintain arch and leg drive

description.overview: Dumbbell bench press variation allowing greater range of motion. Builds chest while improving stability and addressing imbalances.
description.setup: Dumbbells at chest level on bench. Shoulder blades retracted, feet planted for stability.
description.movement: Press dumbbells up and together in arc motion. Lower for deep stretch. Control heavy weights throughout.
description.cues: Arc motion not straight, deep stretch at bottom, press and squeeze together, control the weights

description.overview: Incline dumbbell press targeting upper chest development. Combines incline angle with dumbbell benefits.
description.setup: Incline bench at 30-45 degrees. Dumbbells at chest level. Shoulder blades retracted on pad.
description.movement: Press dumbbells up and together targeting upper chest. Feel stretch at bottom. Control the movement.
description.cues: Feel upper chest working, arc motion together, stretch at bottom, control heavy dumbbells

description.overview: Bench press using slingshot device for assistance. Allows overload at lockout while reducing stress at bottom.
description.setup: Slingshot device around arms. Standard bench setup otherwise. Device assists through sticking point.
description.movement: Lower bar feeling reduced load at bottom. Slingshot assists through middle range. Focus on lockout.
description.cues: Feel the assistance, focus on lockout, heavier than raw bench, control with device

description.overview: Bench press with feet elevated on bench. Eliminates leg drive and arch, focusing purely on chest and arms.
description.setup: Feet up on bench, flat back against pad. No arch available. Grip slightly wider than normal.
description.movement: Press bar with no leg drive assistance. Pure upper body strength. Control the movement throughout.
description.cues: No leg help, flat back, feel chest working harder, control without arch

description.overview: Bench press using cambered Duffalo bar. May be easier on shoulders while providing different stimulus.
description.setup: Duffalo bar with camber down toward chest. May feel different balance. Standard bench position.
description.movement: Press cambered bar feeling different balance demands. May allow deeper stretch. Control the camber.
description.cues: Feel the different balance, may go deeper, control the camber, use the flexibility

description.overview: Bench press with chains adding accommodating resistance. Weight increases through range of motion.
description.setup: Chains draped over barbell. More resistance at top, less at bottom. Standard bench setup.
description.movement: Press bar with increasing resistance as chains lift off floor. Focus on explosive finish.
description.cues: Accelerate through the press, harder at top, finish strong, chains change the feel

description.overview: Partial sumo deadlift from elevated position. Allows heavy loading for sumo lockout strength development.
description.setup: Wide sumo stance with bar on pins at knee level or above. Hands inside legs.
description.movement: Pull from pins to lockout using sumo mechanics. Focus on spreading floor and hip drive.
description.cues: Spread the floor, hips through, heavy sumo lockout, control to pins

description.overview: Sumo deadlift from blocks reducing range of motion. Builds sumo lockout strength and confidence.
description.setup: Wide sumo stance with bar on blocks. Hands inside legs, chest up, knees out.
description.movement: Pull from blocks using sumo technique. Drive feet apart while pulling chest up. Control return.
description.cues: Spread the floor, knees track toes, chest leads, heavy sumo work

description.overview: Combination movement linking squat with calf raise. Builds lower body strength through multiple planes of motion.
description.setup: Standard squat stance with weight of choice. Ready for fluid transition to calf raise.
description.movement: Perform squat, then immediately rise onto toes for calf raise. Lower heels and repeat sequence.
description.cues: Smooth transitions, full squat first, high onto toes, control both movements

description.overview: Explosive movement bringing kettlebell from floor to rack position. Builds power and teaches clean mechanics.
description.setup: Kettlebell between feet, athletic stance. Ready for explosive hip drive and catch in rack.
description.movement: Hike bell back, explosive hip snap, high pull, catch in rack position at shoulder. Control descent.
description.cues: Explosive hips, high pull, soft catch, bell rests on forearm, smooth descent

description.overview: Explosive movement from floor to overhead in one motion. Ultimate power exercise requiring technique and conditioning.
description.setup: Kettlebell between feet, wider stance than clean. Ready for explosive full-body movement.
description.movement: Hike back, explosive hip drive, high pull, punch through to overhead lockout. Control down.
description.cues: Violent hip snap, high pull, punch through overhead, soft lockout, controlled descent

description.overview: Stability exercise with kettlebell overhead while touching floor. Builds shoulder stability and hip mobility.
description.setup: Kettlebell locked out overhead, feet wide. Free hand ready to reach toward floor.
description.movement: Keep bell overhead while hinging to touch floor with free hand. Return maintaining overhead position.
description.cues: Bell stays overhead, hinge at hips, feel hamstring stretch, don't let bell drift

description.overview: Front-loaded squat with kettlebell in rack position. Challenges core stability while building leg strength.
description.setup: Kettlebell in rack position at shoulder. Elbow down, bell rests on forearm. Standard squat stance.
description.movement: Squat down maintaining rack position. Bell challenges posture. Drive up keeping bell stable.
description.cues: Maintain rack position, elbow stays down, fight forward lean, drive through heels

description.overview: Circular movement passing kettlebell around head. Builds shoulder mobility and stability through full range.
description.setup: Light kettlebell held by horns. Standing tall with core engaged. Ready for controlled circular motion.
description.movement: Pass bell around head in smooth circle. Keep core tight. Reverse direction for balance.
description.cues: Smooth circles, core stays tight, control the bell, both directions, light weight only

description.overview: Alternating single-arm rows in bent-over position with two kettlebells. Builds back strength with anti-rotation challenge.
description.setup: Two kettlebells between feet, bent over position. One hand on each bell, athletic stance.
description.movement: Row one bell to hip while other stays on ground. Alternate sides while maintaining position.
description.cues: One at a time, maintain bent position, fight rotation, feel the lat squeeze

description.overview: Hip thrust using barbell for loading. Premier glute exercise allowing maximum load through hip extension.
description.setup: Upper back on bench, barbell in hip crease with pad. Feet flat, knees at 90° at top.
description.movement: Drive through heels to thrust hips up. Full hip extension with glute squeeze. Control descent.
description.cues: Drive through heels, big hip extension, squeeze glutes hard, control the negative

description.overview: Squat with barbell behind legs. Unique loading pattern emphasizing quads while reducing forward lean.
description.setup: Barbell behind legs, deadlift grip behind body. Heels may be elevated. Upright torso.
description.movement: Squat down with bar behind legs. More upright than back squat. Drive up through heels.
description.cues: Bar stays behind, upright torso, feel quads working, heels down or elevated

description.overview: Squat holding barbell in elbow crease. Challenges core massively while building leg strength with front loading.
description.setup: Bar in elbow crease, arms crossed. Pad may be needed. Upright torso position required.
description.movement: Squat down maintaining upright position. Bar loading challenges core. Drive up staying upright.
description.cues: Bar in elbows, stay upright, core works overtime, drive through heels

description.overview: Squat starting from bottom position in pins. Eliminates stretch reflex, builds strength from dead stop.
description.setup: Bar on pins at bottom squat position. Get under bar in squat position. Eliminate momentum.
description.movement: Press up from dead stop in bottom position. No stretch reflex available. Lower back to pins.
description.cues: Start from dead stop, no stretch reflex, pure strength, control back to pins

description.overview: Glute bridge using barbell for heavy loading. Builds maximum glute strength through hip extension pattern.
description.setup: Lying on back with barbell over hips, pad recommended. Feet flat, knees bent. Bar secured in place.
description.movement: Drive hips up squeezing glutes maximally. Create straight line from knees to shoulders. Control descent.
description.cues: Drive heels into floor, massive glute squeeze, full hip extension, control the weight

description.overview: Straddle squat with barbell between legs. Unique loading pattern reducing spinal compression while targeting legs.
description.setup: Straddle barbell with one hand in front, one behind. Athletic stance. Bar between legs.
description.movement: Squat down with bar between legs. Drive up maintaining straddle position. Switch hand positions between sets.
description.cues: Straddle the bar, upright torso, switch grip between sets, feel the different loading

description.overview: Hip hinge movement with bar on back. Builds posterior chain strength and teaches proper hinge mechanics.
description.setup: Bar on upper back like back squat. Feet hip-width apart. Core braced, shoulder blades tight.
description.movement: Hinge at hips pushing back while maintaining flat back. Feel hamstring stretch. Drive hips forward.
description.cues: Hips back not down, chest proud, feel hamstrings, drive hips through to finish

description.overview: Bent-over row starting from floor each rep. Builds explosive back strength and eliminates momentum.
description.setup: Bar on floor, bent over position. Reset to floor between each rep. Parallel torso to floor.
description.movement: Explosively row bar from floor to lower chest. Lower back to floor. Reset position each rep.
description.cues: Dead stop each rep, explosive pull, chest high, reset every time

description.overview: Underhand barbell row with more upright torso. Emphasizes lower lats and biceps involvement.
description.setup: Underhand grip, more upright than traditional row. Torso at 45-degree angle instead of parallel.
description.movement: Row bar to lower abdomen with underhand grip. Feel biceps and lower lats working. Control descent.
description.cues: Underhand grip, more upright, pull to belly, feel biceps helping, squeeze lats

description.overview: Isolation exercise for upper traps using barbell. Builds trap mass and strength through elevation movement.
description.setup: Barbell at arm's length, standing tall. Feet hip-width, shoulders back and down to start.
description.movement: Shrug shoulders straight up as high as possible. Squeeze traps at top. Lower with control.
